summary: Umami is one of the five basic tastes, often described as "savoriness." It's found in foods like meat, fish, mushrooms, and cheese. Our tongues sense umami through special receptors that react to chemicals like glutamates and nucleotides. These are often added to food in the form of MSG or other ingredients. Scientists believe umami is a unique taste, different from sweet, sour, bitter, or salty flavors.
title: Umami
